# Glossary
- CAN Bus: A communication method designed to allow microcontrollers and devices to communicate with each other without a host computer.
- MCU: A microcontroller (MCU) is a small computer on a single integrated circuit (IC) chip.

# Overview
Hydra is uORocketry's next generation of avionics. It is a new system designed with the main goal of being modular. It will be used for both the rocket and the fill cart.

The architecture of Hydra is distributed. The basic unit in the system is a node, with each node being in charge of one or more functions. For example, a temperature sensor node, a servo node, load cell node, etc. Each node contains an MCU, along with any other components it needs to accomplish its tasks. The MCU is also connected to the rest of the system using a CAN Bus. Through that bus, it can receive commands, send commands, and send its status.

The *Main Node* can be thought as the central piece of the system. This node monitors the whole system, communicates with the ground station, and send commands to the other nodes as needed. To keep the system simpler and prevent race conditions, the main node is the only node permitted to send commands. Every other node can only act on commands it receives and report its state.

The ground station connects to the system through the main node. The main node act as a relay for the ground station to the rest of the CAN network. Any messages sent by the ground station are forwarded to the whole network, and CAN messages received by the main node are forwarded to the ground station. This allows the ground station to send commands to any nodes and receive an overview of the system. While most of the time the ground station only sends commands to the main node, sending messages to other nodes is useful for debugging purposes.

# MCU

The ATSAME51J18A MCU is going to be used for all nodes. For more information on that MCU: https://www.microchip.com/en-us/product/ATSAME51J18A
